Key Description: Identifying string linked to the individual or animal being studied, formatted as [site prefix] + [localID]
Identifying string linked to a particular sample or specimen. For RC2 Samples: formatted as [IndividualID] + [Sample Type Abbreviation] + [Sample letter key] + [Subcategory of analysis type]

Key indicating additional information about samples. Should match key found in RC2 Sample ID. For biopsy: suggested location, inflammation status, and preservation method. For blood: blood component, preservation method.
Funding source used to support sampling. May be necessary information to determine scope of sharing permissions.
The type of sample being described
Biopsy actual location
Biopsy inflammation status
The number of biopsies
The method of preservation for biopsy samples
The volume of serum, PBMC, PAX collected
The units the volume is reported in
The number of cells for PBMC samples as # x 10^6
The date sample was collected in format YYYY-MM-DD
The general diagnosis category
Any additional notes about the biospecimen
Tracking number issued by vendor. this can be used to identify shipping "batches" i.e. samples that were shipped at the same time under the same conditions
The vendor used to ship biosamples
Sample originator. Should match prefix on RC2 Sample ID
The unique ID, if there is one that is separate from the specimen ID (for example, if sites use their own internal unique ID). Some sites may collect this but not all
Number of cells or nuclei sequenced
A cell phenotype that consists of the cell's disposition to survive and develop normally. Provided as number of live cells per unit volume
A cell phenotype that consists of the cell's disposition to survive and develop normally.
